arm_group.description: 26 patients received general anesthesia combined with epidural anesthesia for surgery, and patient-controlled epidural analgesia for 2 days after surgery
27 patients received general anesthesia for surgery, and patient-controlled intravenous analgesia for 2 days after surgery

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to prove whether general anesthesia combined with epidural
      anesthesia could better maintain body balance of Th1/Th2 and Treg/Th17 compared with general
      anesthesia, so as to reduce the surgical stress-related immunosuppression, and to improve
      the prognosis.

clinical_study.brief_title: General Anesthesia Combined With Epidural Anesthesia Mitigates the Surgical Stress-related Immunosuppression in Patients With Colorectal Cancer

intervention.description: Patients received general anesthesia for surgery

oversight_info.authority: China: Science and Technology Commission of Shanghai Municipality

primary_outcome.description: The changes of peripheral subtype of T-helper, myeloid-derived suppressor cells(MDSCs) and cytokines
primary_outcome.measure: The changes of peripheral immune cells and cytokines
primary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 5 days after surgery
